body:
Compiling pyfftw with `gcc 5.3.0 +binutils` on Centos7 fails due to linker error against `fftw`. The issue I see is that `gcc` is not being passed the `fftw` path in the `-L` flag. see line 43 in error below. Is this an issue with spack or `setuptools`? It looks like spack not passing the the right information to `setuptools`?

Invocation is:

```
spack install -j 16 py-pyfftw%gcc@binutils_5.3.0 ^fftw@3.3.6-pl2~mpi+pfft_patches ^py-numpy +blas ^openblas virtual_machine=True threads=pthreads
```
